subtasks: Sit on the combine operator's seat
Engage the engine and start the combine
Adjust the combine's harvesting settings
Drive the combine through the crop field
Monitor the combine's performance during harvesting
Use telehandlers or similar equipment for placing bales
Insert bale pointers into bales to secure them
Stack and organize the bales as needed
Load combine into a trailer or other transport vehicle
Secure the crops in the trailer with ties or straps
Drive the trailer to the desired location
Unload the crops from the combine or trailer
Discharge the crops into the appropriate storage or processing area
Position the combine implement into the right position for land preparation
Engage the implements to work the soil, such as tilling or cultivating
Monitor the soil conditions and adjust the implement's settings as needed
Operate the soil-working equipment to prepare seedbeds
Attach or connect fertilizer or chemical applicator tools to the combine
Set the appropriate rates and distribution patterns for spreaders
Operate the spreader or applicator while moving through the field
Check the coverage and adjust the spreader settings if necessary
Attach planting implements to the combine or tractor
Adjust the planting depth and planter settings
Drive through the field, planting seeds into the prepared soil
Monitor the planting process and ensure consistent row spacing and depth
Position the combine in the field to start harvesting
Adjust the combine's header to match the crop type (e.g., wheat, soybeans)
Navigate the combine through the crop rows, harvesting in sections
Check the grain quality and separator settings during harvest
Load harvested grain into bins or trucks as needed
Inspect the combine for any issues before and after operations
Clean and lubricate moving parts of the combine and attachments
Replace worn or damaged parts on the equipment
Follow safety protocols when servicing the combine or other equipment
